artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait (bijin-ga); woman wearing light purple and white kimono, batting at a firefly in ULC with a green and white fan
inscription: 昭和九年六月 {Shōwa kunen rokugatsu} (June 1934)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 深水 {Shinsui} | LRC, red publisher seal: ワタナベ {Watanabe} | LR: publisher seal: 版権所有　渡邊庄三郎 {hanken shoyū Watanabe Shōzaburō} (copyright Watanabe Shōzaburō) | on back, red seal: 貮百五拾枚絶版　第貮百四拾番 {nihyakugojū mai zeppan, dai nihyakuyonjū ban} (edition of 250, number 240) | red square publisher seal: わたなべ {Watanabe}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Second Collection of Modern Beauties (Gendai bijin shū dai nishū 現代美人集第二輯)
text: A young woman is about to bat a firefly with her round fan. She will then place the paralyzed firefly into a cage and collect more to release them all at once later.
title: Firefly
